conclusion: The process forms a complete thermodynamic cycle returning to state A.
A→B is an isochoric process (constant volume).
B→C is a process with decreasing pressure and increasing volume.
C→A is an isochoric process (constant volume).
Work is given by W = ∫P·dV for any process.
For process A→B, since volume remains constant (dV = 0), W_AB = 0.
For process B→C, work is calculated as the area under the P-V curve, which is a trapezoid.
Width of trapezoid for B→C is (5 - 2) L = 3 L.
Heights of trapezoid for B→C are 4×10⁵ Pa and 1×10⁵ Pa.
Area of trapezoid for B→C is (1/2) × (3 L) × (4×10⁵ Pa + 1×10⁵ Pa) = 7.5×10⁵ Pa·L.
For process C→A, since volume is constant, W_CA = 0.
Total work W_total = W_AB + W_BC + W_CA = 0 + 7.5×10⁵ Pa·L + 0 = 7.5×10⁵ Pa·L.
Convert W_total to SI units: 7.5×10⁵ Pa·L = 7.5×10⁵ Pa × 10⁻³ m³ = 750 J.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings during the cyclic process is 750 J.
